page.title: 13Industry and Work in Cwmbran
page.content: An industrial revolution has transformed Cwmbran. The mines and quarries have been replaced by a great diversity of successful industries. The valley's principal products are now micro-processors and computer equipment, dairy machinery, valves, biscuits, cosmetics, clothes and motor components. A large proportion of our fathers are employed, the majority in local factories where they are on shift-work About half of our mothers work, mostly in schools and shops. Most of our fathers travel to their work by car,while our mothers walk, one or two use the bus. Nearly everyone finds the work they do interesting or very interesting and all but two were happy in their job. Compiled from a survey by: Mark,Matthew,Peter & Steven (Oakfield)
